name: Pot Luck 4 Quiz | Mixed 20 Questions | 20 Questions

questions.text: How many states of the USA are considered to be commonwealths?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Massachusetts, Kentucky, Pennsylvania and Virgina.

questions.text: What female singer had a hit with 'Blame It On The Bossa Nova'?
questions.explanation:
Eydie Gorme.

	In 1963.

questions.text: 'The Afternoon Of A Faun'. What was it?
questions.explanation: Ballet.

questions.text: What fruit did Elvis Presley layer on his peanut butter sandwiches?
questions.explanation:
Bananas.

	To each his own.

questions.text: In what state did Patsy Cline's plane crash?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee.

	March 1963 near Camden, Tennessee.

questions.text: In what country was Sirhan Sirhan born?
questions.explanation:
Palestine.

	He assassinated Robert F. Kennedy in June of 1968.

questions.text: Which is not a first name of one of the original sons on TV's 'My Three Sons'?
questions.explanation: Jerry.

questions.text: How many scoops of ice cream would you find in the majority of banana splits in the US?
What is the largest U.S. state, in area, east of the Mississippi River?
questions.explanation:
Georgia.

	Georgia 57,919 square miles, New York 47,224 square miles, Pennsylvania 44,820 square miles and Tennessee 41,220 square miles.

questions.text: Name the state of the USA that first beat out Wisconsin in 1997 to become the top producer of milk and butter.
questions.explanation:
California.

	Although traditionally Wisconsin was the largest producer of milk and butter, after 1997 California became the largest.

questions.text: Which of the following does not describe a swamp?
questions.explanation:
Heath.

	Heath is a track of open land.

questions.text: Who played the role of Fletch in the movie of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Chevy Chase.

	He was an investigative reporter.

questions.text: Which musical instrument has a part called a frog?
questions.explanation:
Violin.

	It's the part of the bow used to tighten the hair.

questions.text: What breed of dog is called the 'king of the terriers'?
questions.explanation: Airedale.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a type of airplane?
questions.explanation:
Hovercraft.

	A hovercraft travels on water or to be more correct on top of water.

questions.text: What is a bombax?
questions.explanation:
Tree.

	The bombax or kapok a family of flowering trees or shrubs.

questions.text: Which of the following is the best electrical conductor?
questions.explanation:
Silver.

	Copper is used more because of the cost.

questions.text: What type of seafood is a bluepoint?
questions.explanation:
Oyster.

	A bivalve mollusk mainly from the Blue Point Long Island area.

questions.text: The subclavian vein carries blood to the heart from where?
questions.explanation:
Arm.

	It joins with other veins at approximately the level of the collarbone.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an evergreen?
questions.explanation: Sycamore.
